references.paper_title: Conservative objective models for effective offline model-based optimization
references.reason: This paper introduces a crucial method for offline model-based optimization, which is the main focus of the current work and is directly built upon.
This is a very recent and highly relevant work in offline model-based optimization that directly compares against the proposed method.
This foundational paper in generative adversarial networks (GANs) is leveraged to inspire the design of the adaptive source critic regularization algorithm.
This paper introduces the Wasserstein GAN, which is a key component of the adaptive source critic regularization algorithm, enhancing its stability and performance.

references.paper_title: Scalable global optimization via local Bayesian optimization
references.reason: This paper introduces a state-of-the-art Bayesian optimization algorithm used as a baseline for comparison and is closely related to the proposed work.
